thread.title: Arsenal vs Hull LIVE score: Follow the EPL action | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Arsenal vs Hull LIVE score: Follow the EPL action | Daily Mail Online

author: Adam Shergold For Mailonline
title: Arsenal vs Hull LIVE score: Follow the EPL action | Daily Mail Online
text:
Here's how the top six in the Premier League looks 11:16 It's snowing in London... but the Emirates pitch looks immaculate! 11:15 Is the end nigh for Wenger? 
Arsenal legend Ian Wright claims Arsene Wenger has confided in him that he is 'coming to the end' of his time managing the club. 
Wenger's contract expires at the end of the season and he is yet to sign an extension while refusing to comment on his future. 
Wright met with the Arsenal manager this week and said he 'looked tired', revealing the Frenchman gave him a first-ever indication that he was nearing an exit after 21 years in charge. A cardboard cut out of Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger next to a merchandise stall outside the Emirates 11:11 Can Arsenal rediscover their winning touch? 
Hello and welcome to another fascinating weekend at both the top and the bottom of the Premier League and a Saturday lunchtime match that will impact on both ends. 
After back-to-back defeats against Watford and Chelsea saw their title hopes fade to nothing, Arsenal need a confidence-boosting three points as they cement their top four place. 
Rather inevitably, the future of manager Arsene Wenger is once again under the microscope with suggestions overnight that he may be coming to the end of his 21-year tenure. 
Hull remain in the relegation zone but can move out of it with a shock win at the Emirates. They have been performing better since Marco Silva took over and beat Liverpool last weekend. They'll be no pushovers for sure. 
For those of you not in London, it is a bitterly cold February day and there is snow in the air. It'll be chilly at the Emirates and we'll see if that chill factor extends to the Arsenal team. 
Kick-off is at 12.30 and we'll bring you plenty of build-up beforehand, including the team news at around 11.30. Early arrivals at the Emirates Stadium admire the statue of Thierry Henry {"id":"4214362","channel":"/sport","pageUrl":"http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-4214362/Arsenal-vs-Hull-LIVE-score-Follow-EPL-action.html","status":"running","greenBox":{"body":""},"modifiedOrder":1} 0 0 Arsenal will be looking to end a two-game losing streak in the Premier League when struggling Hull visit on Saturday. Arsene Wenger's side have been beaten by Watford and Chelsea in their last two games and have fallen 12 points behind the leaders. Marco Silva's Hull remain in the relegation zone but are just one point from safety after beating Liverpool last time out. Join Sportsmail's ADAM SHERGOLD for live coverage as it happens at the Emirates Stadium, with kick-off at 12.30GMT. RELATED ARTICLES
